pullRequest.body:
The canonical bilinear form for a root pairing over a linearly ordered commutative ring is nondegenerate when restricted to the span of roots.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [4c23080813](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18569/commits/4c23080813d6727edf284fe661ab88cefcf01a66)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.RootSystem.Finite.Nondegenerate`|1393|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ LinearMap.finrank_le_of_smul_regular`
`+ Submodule.disjoint_ker_of_finrank_eq`
`+ _root_.RootSystem.rootForm_anisotropic`
`+ corootSpan`
`+ disjoint_rootSpan_ker_polarization`
`+ eq_zero_of_mem_rootSpan_of_rootForm_self_eq_zero`
`+ finrank_corootSpan_eq`
`+ finrank_rootSpan_map_polarization_eq_finrank_corootSpan`
`+ instance : Module.Finite R P.corootSpan := Finite.span_of_finite R <| finite_range P.coroot`
`+ instance : Module.Finite R P.rootSpan := Finite.span_of_finite R <| finite_range P.root`
`+ instance [IsDomain R] : NoZeroSMulDivisors R M := by`
`+ mem_ker_polarization_of_rootForm_self_eq_zero`
`+ prod_rootForm_root_self_pos`
`+ prod_rootForm_smul_coroot_mem_range_domRestrict`
`+ range_polarization_domRestrict_le_span_coroot`
`+ rank_le_of_smul_regular`
`+ rootForm_pos_of_nonzero`
`+ rootForm_restrict_nondegenerate`
`+ rootForm_rootPositive`
`+ rootForm_root_self_pos`
`+ rootForm_self_non_neg`
`+ rootForm_self_zero_iff`
`+ rootSpan`
`+ sum_mul_self_eq_zero_iff`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Possible approach for the contents of `Nondegenerate.lean` which I think should work well:
```lean
section GeneralScalarsMoveToDefs

abbrev rootSpan := span R (range P.root)

abbrev corootSpan := span R (range P.coroot)

instance : Module.Finite R P.rootSpan := Finite.span_of_finite R <| finite_range P.root

instance : Module.Finite R P.corootSpan := Finite.span_of_finite R <| finite_range P.coroot

end GeneralScalarsMoveToDefs

@[simp]
lemma finrank_rootSpan_map_polarization_eq_finrank_corootSpan :
    finrank R (P.rootSpan.map P.Polarization) = finrank R P.corootSpan := by
  sorry

@[simp]
lemma finrank_corootSpan_map_coPolarization_eq_finrank_crootSpan :
    finrank R (P.corootSpan.map P.CoPolarization) = finrank R P.rootSpan :=
  P.flip.finrank_rootSpan_map_polarization_eq_finrank_corootSpan

/-- An auxiliary lemma en route to `RootPairing.finrank_corootSpan_eq`. -/
private lemma finrank_corootSpan_le :
    finrank R P.corootSpan ≤ finrank R P.rootSpan := by
  sorry

lemma finrank_corootSpan_eq :
    finrank R P.corootSpan = finrank R P.rootSpan :=
  le_antisymm P.finrank_corootSpan_le P.flip.finrank_corootSpan_le

lemma disjoint_rootSpan_ker_polarization :
    Disjoint P.rootSpan (LinearMap.ker P.Polarization) := by
  sorry

lemma mem_ker_polarization_of_rootForm_self_eq_zero {x : M} (hx : P.RootForm x x = 0) :
    x ∈ LinearMap.ker P.Polarization := by
  rw [LinearMap.mem_ker, Polarization_apply]
  rw [rootForm_self_zero_iff] at hx
  exact Fintype.sum_eq_zero _ fun i ↦ by simp [hx i]

lemma eq_zero_of_mem_rootSpan_of_rootForm_self_eq_zero {x : M}
    (hx : x ∈ P.rootSpan) (hx' : P.RootForm x x = 0) :
    x = 0 := by
  rw [← Submodule.mem_bot (R := R), ← P.disjoint_rootSpan_ker_polarization.eq_bot]
  exact ⟨hx, P.mem_ker_polarization_of_rootForm_self_eq_zero hx'⟩

-- Requires adding `import Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.QuadraticForm.Basic`
lemma _root_.RootSystem.rootFormAnisotropic (P : RootSystem ι R M N) :
    P.RootForm.toQuadraticMap.Anisotropic := by
  refine fun x ↦ P.eq_zero_of_mem_rootSpan_of_rootForm_self_eq_zero ?_
  rw [rootSpan, P.span_eq_top]
  exact Submodule.mem_top
```
bot fix style

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11941300451/job/33285829549)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11941300451/job/33285829825)

Very nice!

I've just done a first pass. However I can't help wondering if you really need to be working with both `Module.rank` and `Module.finrank`. Would it be possible to avoid `Module.rank` and just use `Module.finrank` throughout?

Very nice!

I've just done a first pass. However I can't help wondering if you really need to be working with both `Module.rank` and `Module.finrank`. Would it be possible to avoid `Module.rank` and just use `Module.finrank` throughout?
I will try to review more later

I couldn't resist a little golf:
```suggestion
  let g : M →ₗ[R] M :=
    { toFun := fun x ↦ r • x
      map_add' := by simp
      map_smul' := fun s x ↦ by simp [← smul_assoc, IsMulCentral.comm hrc s] }
  exact (g.restrict h).rank_le_of_injective <| fun _ _ h ↦ by simpa using hr (Subtype.ext_iff.mp h)
```
Possibly what is called `g` here should be extracted to a definition in its own right.

I note we already have [LinearMap.lsmul](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/BilinearMap.html#LinearMap.lsmul) but that requires `CommRing` because it is also linear in `R`.
`Algebra.lsmul` works fine here - I let `R` be an `S`-algebra for a `CommSemiring S`.
This should be moved. I think possibly `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.BigOperators.Ring.Finset` might be a good home.

```suggestion
  [Module R N] (P : RootPairing ι R M N)
```

```suggestion
  simp
```

```suggestion
  simp
```

```suggestion
  obtain ⟨c, hc⟩ : P.RootForm (P.root i) (P.root i) ∣ ∏ a : ι, P.RootForm (P.root a) (P.root a) :=
```
and then drop `obtain ⟨c, hc⟩ := hdvd` below

```suggestion
lemma prod_rootForm_smul_coroot_mem_range_domRestrict (i : ι) :
```

How about we add:
```lean
open Set
open Submodule (span)
```
at the top of the file and then we can write this as:
```suggestion
    LinearMap.range (P.Polarization.domRestrict (span R (range P.root))) ≤
```

Or maybe even introduce:
```lean
abbrev rootSpan := span R (range P.root)
abbrev corootSpan := span R (range P.coroot)
```
over in `RootSystem.Defs`?

```suggestion
      LinearMap.range (P.Polarization.domRestrict (span R (range P.root))) := by
```

```suggestion
# Nondegeneracy of the polarization on a finite root pairing

We show that if the base ring of a finite root pairing is linearly ordered, then the canonical
```

```suggestion
Weyl group.

## Main results:
```

```suggestion
  non-positive norm.

## References:
```

```suggestion
 * Bourbaki, Lie groups and Lie algebras

## Todo
```

```suggestion
  [Module R N] (P : RootPairing ι R M N)
```

We need to fully qualify names to make our docs links work
```suggestion
 * `RootPairing.rootForm_rootPositive`: `RootForm` is root-positive.
```
(likewise the two below)

You can proceed with:
```suggestion
  have := P.polarization_domRestrict_kernel_rank_zero
  rwa [Submodule.rank_eq_zero] at this
```
However I think it would be better to proceed as:
```lean
  rw [LinearMap.ker_domRestrict, ← Submodule.disjoint_iff_comap_eq_bot]
```
and restate `polarization_domRestrict_kernel_rank_zero` as suggested below.

I usually state everything lattice theoretically when I can because we have such good coverage. So how about instead:
```suggestion
lemma disjoint_rootSpan_ker_polarization :
    Disjoint (span R (range P.root)) (LinearMap.ker P.Polarization) := by
```

```suggestion
lemma _root_.RootSystem.rootForm_anisotropic (P : RootSystem ι R M N) :
```

```suggestion
lemma Submodule.disjoint_ker_of_finrank_eq [NoZeroSMulDivisors R M] {N : Type*} [AddCommGroup N]
```
Could you please add these to `docs/references.bib` if they do not exist yet? And then refer to them here.

```suggestion

We show that if the base ring of a finite root pairing is linearly ordered, then the canonical
```
Idem about the bib file.

```suggestion
 * Weyl-invariance of `RootForm` and `CorootForm`
```

Very minor suggestion
```suggestion
  apply (Submodule.finrank_mono P.range_polarization_domRestrict_le_span_coroot).antisymm
```

```suggestion
    P.RootForm.toQuadraticMap.Anisotropic :=
  fun x ↦ P.eq_zero_of_mem_rootSpan_of_rootForm_self_eq_zero <| by
    simpa only [rootSpan, P.span_eq_top] using Submodule.mem_top
```

```suggestion
  apply (P.rootForm_self_non_neg x).lt_of_ne
```

Super minor comments. Feel free to ignore.
```suggestion
  rw [or_iff_not_imp_left]
  intro hr
  suffices Dual.eval R M m = Dual.eval R M 0 from (bijective_dual_eval R M).injective this
  ext n
  simp only [Dual.eval_apply, map_zero, LinearMap.zero_apply]
  suffices r • n m = 0 from eq_zero_of_ne_zero_of_mul_left_eq_zero hr this
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat (LinearAlgebra/RootSystem/Finite): nondegeneracy of canonical bilinear form restricted to root span

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).

Very nice!

I've just done a first pass. However I can't help wondering if you really need to be working with both `Module.rank` and `Module.finrank`. Would it be possible to avoid `Module.rank` and just use `Module.finrank` throughout?

Possible approach for the contents of `Nondegenerate.lean` which I think should work well:
```lean
section GeneralScalarsMoveToDefs

abbrev rootSpan := span R (range P.root)

abbrev corootSpan := span R (range P.coroot)

instance : Module.Finite R P.rootSpan := Finite.span_of_finite R <| finite_range P.root

instance : Module.Finite R P.corootSpan := Finite.span_of_finite R <| finite_range P.coroot

end GeneralScalarsMoveToDefs

@[simp]
lemma finrank_rootSpan_map_polarization_eq_finrank_corootSpan :
    finrank R (P.rootSpan.map P.Polarization) = finrank R P.corootSpan := by
  sorry

@[simp]
lemma finrank_corootSpan_map_coPolarization_eq_finrank_crootSpan :
    finrank R (P.corootSpan.map P.CoPolarization) = finrank R P.rootSpan :=
  P.flip.finrank_rootSpan_map_polarization_eq_finrank_corootSpan

/-- An auxiliary lemma en route to `RootPairing.finrank_corootSpan_eq`. -/
private lemma finrank_corootSpan_le :
    finrank R P.corootSpan ≤ finrank R P.rootSpan := by
  sorry

lemma finrank_corootSpan_eq :
    finrank R P.corootSpan = finrank R P.rootSpan :=
  le_antisymm P.finrank_corootSpan_le P.flip.finrank_corootSpan_le

lemma disjoint_rootSpan_ker_polarization :
    Disjoint P.rootSpan (LinearMap.ker P.Polarization) := by
  sorry

lemma mem_ker_polarization_of_rootForm_self_eq_zero {x : M} (hx : P.RootForm x x = 0) :
    x ∈ LinearMap.ker P.Polarization := by
  rw [LinearMap.mem_ker, Polarization_apply]
  rw [rootForm_self_zero_iff] at hx
  exact Fintype.sum_eq_zero _ fun i ↦ by simp [hx i]

lemma eq_zero_of_mem_rootSpan_of_rootForm_self_eq_zero {x : M}
    (hx : x ∈ P.rootSpan) (hx' : P.RootForm x x = 0) :
    x = 0 := by
  rw [← Submodule.mem_bot (R := R), ← P.disjoint_rootSpan_ker_polarization.eq_bot]
  exact ⟨hx, P.mem_ker_polarization_of_rootForm_self_eq_zero hx'⟩

-- Requires adding `import Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.QuadraticForm.Basic`
lemma _root_.RootSystem.rootFormAnisotropic (P : RootSystem ι R M N) :
    P.RootForm.toQuadraticMap.Anisotropic := by
  refine fun x ↦ P.eq_zero_of_mem_rootSpan_of_rootForm_self_eq_zero ?_
  rw [rootSpan, P.span_eq_top]
  exact Submodule.mem_top
```
